Survey App

Realtime survey using React with a Socket.io based Node.js/Express backend.

Visit the website view code

About this project

This project was created to meet a need I had as I mentored youth in the era of meeting through video calls. Many teenagers don't engage willingly using their microphones, so I created a survey app to pose questions and interact with student responses in real-time. To use the app you can login with user: rick and password: perez. As a host you can create survey questions with responses in muliple choice or free response. Then anyone users who use the website will receive your survey and can respond in real-time. To acheive bi-directional event-based communication I built the backend from scratch using Node.js with the Socket.io library. I also used the Material-ui library extensively to speed up styling of react components. Some challenges I had to overcome was understanding React's useEffect hook to re-render, together with Socket.io event-based architecture, at the correct time. Another challenge was learning to use Material-ui globably to get styles across different components and improve reuse.
